45:59 Caption: The performance from both teams could be described as average. There have been only a few exciting situations and the fans will be expecting more in the second half. Neither team was able to take the initiative and dominate the first half. Long balls and crosses are the strongest weapons of the home team, while their opponents favour possession football.

48:59 Caption: This hugely entertaining encounter was a wonderful experience for every football lover to behold. The players did their utmost to make the game very enjoyable. There wasn't any significant dominance by either side in this game. The home side's tactic was kick and rush football, the exact opposite of the away team who made a lot of passes and attempted to maintain possession.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Cagliari and AS Roma played out an enthralling encounter at the Sardegna Arena that ended in a dramatic 2-2 draw. The match, full of intensity and intrigue, kept fans on the edge of their seats from the first whistle to the last. Each side took turns in dictating the tempo, with neither team managing to establish clear dominance over the other.

The first half began with Cagliari kicking off, immediately setting the pace. However, just 16 seconds in, a foul by a Cagliari player resulted in an indirect free-kick for AS Roma. The visitors managed to conjure up a shot off target shortly thereafter. Cagliari’s defense stood firm initially, with Di Gennaro and others making timely clearances. The scrappy play led to several throw-ins as both teams struggled to maintain possession. In what was becoming a pattern, repeated fouls by Cagliari gave AS Roma multiple opportunities to press forward.

By the fifth minute, AS Roma had their first shot on target. This was followed by a crucial moment in the match when AS Roma were awarded a penalty. The pressure was on as the penalty was taken without hesitation and brilliantly converted to give AS Roma a 1-0 lead. Cagliari, undeterred, resumed with a kickoff and tried to push forward. But their initial attempts, including a shot by Davide Di Gennaro from 24 meters out that flew just wide, bore no fruit.

Cagliari demonstrated moments of promise, stringing together passes proficiently. Marco Borriello found himself in a promising position but his attempt was blocked by an AS Roma defender. This sequence led to a corner for Cagliari. Although they couldn’t capitalize immediately, the home team's persistence was clear. Yet, they were constantly met by a resolute AS Roma defense, epitomized by Wojciech Szczesny’s commanding presence in goal.

The first half was littered with stoppages as both sides committed fouls. Cagliari’s aggressive play saw them rack up yellow cards; Mauricio Isla was among the first to be booked for incessant arguing with the referee. Nicola Murru soon followed, earning a caution for a heavy challenge. Despite these setbacks, Cagliari continued to fight for every ball. In the 35th minute, Marco Sau brought out an excellent save from Szczesny, keeping the score to 1-0. The final minutes of the first half saw Alessandro Florenzi of AS Roma get booked for a foul, a brief skirmish that encapsulated the first half's combative nature.

The second half began with AS Roma making a tactical change by bringing on Edin Dzeko. This substitution proved to be inspired as, within minutes, AS Roma doubled their lead. Dzeko’s influence was immediate as his headed pass set up Kevin Strootman for a clinical finish, putting AS Roma 2-0 ahead. The Sardegna Arena fell silent as AS Roma celebrated.

Still, Cagliari did not lose heart. Marco Borriello brought the home fans back to life with a close-range finish following a pin-point rebound shot from Marco Sau. The quick response reduced the deficit to 1-2 and ignited the tie once again. From there, the match escalated further in intensity.

Both teams employed different tactical approaches throughout the match. Cagliari frequently resorted to long balls, seeking to bypass AS Roma’s midfield with direct attacks. Oppositely, AS Roma looked to control proceedings through sustained possession. These contrasting styles made for a gripping spectacle.

There were more fouls recorded as both teams grappled to seize midfield control. Cagliari introduced fresh legs to further their comeback attempt, with Niccolo Giannetti coming on to replace Simone Padoin. AS Roma made their own changes aimed at shoring up their defense, substituting Federico Fazio for Diego Perotti.

The match saw several periods of dominance from either side. AS Roma were content to draw Cagliari out, hoping to exploit spaces left behind. Roma's Bruno Peres almost extended their lead with a stunning solo run, only to be denied by a superb save.

As the clock ticked, the game began to ebb and flow with more extreme vigour. Edin Dzeko of AS Roma found himself at the heart of AS Roma’s attack. He lashed a shot toward Cagliari’s goal, only to see it saved resolutely. But it was Cagliari who had the final say, snatching a dramatic equalizer. Mauricio Isla demonstrated his crossing prowess, delivering a perfect ball for Marco Sau, who headed it in spectacularly off the post, leveling the score 2-2 late in the game. 

Cagliari’s joy was palpable. They had clawed back from a seemingly insurmountable position, displaying resilience and determination. The closing minutes were marked by a last-ditch effort from both sides, as they each sought a winner.

Injury time saw AS Roma earn multiple corners, the tension rising with each delivery into Cagliari’s box. But the home team’s defense stood resolute. Every AS Roma attempt was met with sturdy resistance from Cagliari defenders, matched by Marco Storari’s steadfast goalkeeping.

The final whistle blew, bringing to a close a match that celebrated the spirit of the game. Both sides had shown moments of brilliance, resilience, and determination. The resulting 2-2 scoreline was a fair reflection of a contest that neither team deserved to lose. Cagliari, through their grit and determination, showcased why they deserve their place in Serie A, while AS Roma demonstrated their tactical acumen and quality in management.

The fans at the Sardegna Arena witnessed a spectacle of football, full of drama and excitement. While neither team could claim total dominance, the match displayed the indomitable spirit of football, where determination, skill, and the love for the game culminate in moments that stay etched in memory.

As the dust settled, the players exchanged jerseys and handshakes, a sign of respect after a hard-fought 90 minutes. The result leaves both teams with points to ponder, strategies to polish, and the anticipation of their next encounter. Both sets of supporters will remember this thriller – a match filled with goals, chances, fouls, and, above all, an undying spirit of competition.
